entry.title: compromise
entry.content:
compromise

modest natural-language processing.

compromise is not the cleverest, but it is small, quick, and good-enough for a bunch of nlp stuff!

Don't miss to checkout their site compromise.cool!

GET IT: npm install compromise

Sample usages:

```js

const nlp = require('compromise')

const doc = nlp('JS is calling') doc.sentences().toNegative() // 'JS is not calling'

```

js doc = nlp("the guest-singer's bj√∂rk at seven thirty.").normalize().out('text') // 'The guest singer is Bjork at 7:30.'

js doc = nlp("we're not gonna take it, no we ain't gonna take it.") doc.has('going') // true doc.match('are not').length // == 2 doc.contractions().expand().out() //'we are not going to take it, no we are not going to take it'

GIT FTW!
